::Slayer::

Slayer nods at Ignatius's explanation, listening to his battle plan. 
It didn't sound too complicated, except for that the Maximals were a 
fairly large faction. Taking several of them could cause lots of 
problems for the Trainers.

"Allright," he agrees after a moment of hesitation, "Let me go review 
whatever recent comms the base has picked up from that area first, 
though."

He turns and walks to a console, tapping a few buttons to bring up 
any intercepted comms.



--- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Ignatius looked Slayer square in the eye, "There seems to be some 
bad mech
> fluid between you and the Maximals, it shouldn't be to hard to get 
thier
> attention." Ignatius activates his Recon map of the mountains 
shoeing a
> particular dropoff near a sharp turn. "I can position myself here." 
points
> to top of the dropoff. "You lead one or two Maxi pads through 
here."  points
> to lower portion of dropoff leading around corner. "Our prey will 
be trapped
> between us while we retain all the cover." The plan seemed simple 
enough
> with one exception, there was no way of knowing which Maximal would 
follow
> them, or how many. If successful they could scavenge the parts from 
the
> bots, or trade bodies for parts.
> 
> Ignatius brought up the menu from the cargo hold. "We can use these 
to
> confuse the scanners." He points out an item labled Mirror sensors. 
Items
> designed to reflect a bots image and energy signature making it 
difficult to
> determine how many bots there were.
